text.section:
The board may grant a license to an applicant currently licensed in another state as a speech-language pathologist upon receipt of the following:
A letter of good standing in that state;
Documentation of national certification or a passing score on a national exam approved by the board; and
A certified university transcript conferring at least a master's degree in communication disorders.

The board may grant a license to an applicant currently licensed in another state as an audiologist upon receipt of the following:
A letter of good standing in that state;
Documentation of national certification or a passing score on a national exam approved by the board; and
A certified university transcript conferring a master's degree in audiology prior to January 1, 2007, or a doctorate degree in audiology.

law.history: Created 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 165, sec. 6, effective July 15, 2008.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/15/2008). A manifest clerical or typographical error has been corrected in this statute during codification under the authority of KRS 7.136(1)(h).
